info.game_comments:
2005 Ultimate Tournament of Champions Round 1, game 45.

(Edward Albee: Hello.  I'm Edward Albee.  I write plays.  It's time to play "get the contestants".  So join me next, on Jeopardy!)

double_jeopardy_round: I SAW IT ON TV & I HAD TO HAVE IT

(1, 1).clue: Fox sitcom featuring Hank, Bobby, Peggy & Luanne

(2, 1).clue: These quilled critters & their relationship to humans poked their way into the May 1992 issue

(3, 1).clue: To begin this swimming stroke, rest your head on your arm, which is extended ahead with the palm turned downward

(4, 1).clue: This Italian city's biennial, the oldest in the world, has exhibits on the Lido & the Island of San Giorgio

(1, 2).clue: Roger Miller won 5 Grammys in 1965 for this hit

(2, 2).clue: The 1930s art deco architecture of this Florida city with a 2-word name was featured in the December 1982 issue

(3, 2).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew plays a card game with Sarah.)  We've gone through the flop & turn cards of this geographic game; now it's time for the river card

(4, 2).clue: This country's first "Documenta" highlighted the artists of the "Degenerate Art" propaganda exhibit of 1937

(5, 2).clue: October 15, 1858:These 2 men who wanted to be U.S. Senator from Illinois

(2, 3).clue: The inaugural issue from April 1970 featured a cover story on a breeding program for these animals in Sri Lanka

(3, 3).clue: On April 19, 1906 dynamiting to create a firebreak on Van Ness Ave. was tried to contain the blaze sweeping this city

(4, 3).clue: Anselm Kiefer & Richard Serra shared the Carnegie Prize at this city's "International"

(6, 3).clue: '80s sci-fi blockbuster miniseries concerning man-eating reptilian aliens

(1, 4).clue: Bruce Boxleitner & Kate Jackson were the title duo on this '80s TV show

(2, 4).clue: A January 1996 article explored how this country was doing 20 years after the American pullout

(3, 4).clue: Steve McQueen knew it's French for "butterfly"

(4, 4).clue: This Vanderbilt-funded museum in NYC has held a renowned biennial since 1973

(6, 4).clue: Feel enriched if you know this symbol for the 92nd element of the periodic table

(1, 5).clue: Jeffrey Hunter played Jesus & Rip Torn played Judas in this 1961 Bible big-screener

(2, 5).clue: From hand-hewn hideaways to rustic mansions, these wooden residences were featured in the March 1992 issue

(3, 5).clue: Photographer Robert Frank documented the people of the U.S. in a '50s book with this simple title

(4, 5).clue: Venues for this country's biennial have included the Hagia Eirene Museum & the Yerebatan Cistern

(5, 5).clue: October 11, 1992:These 3 men vying to be Commander in Chief
(5, 5).correct response: Perot, Clinton, and George Herbert Walker Bush

(6, 5).clue: Also known as a transverse wave, this type of wave is found in an earthquake

(1, 1).clue: Following victory in the first crusade, Baldwin became the first European king of this city in 1100 A.D.

(2, 1).clue: Thousands of folks wanted furniture from Pottery Barn after Rachel purchased some on this sitcom

(3, 1).clue: Type of squirrel that has a thin, extending membrane called a patagium

(4, 1).clue: I need my favorite albums on CD--I only have them on this, meaning "small box"

(5, 1).clue: This is the only American car maker that uses a one-letter stock symbol

(6, 1).clue: (Hello, I'm Edward Albee.)  My first play, "The Zoo Story", had its world premiere way, way off Broadway... in this largest German city

(1, 2).clue: A 1952 military coup forced the abdication of Farouk I, the last king of this African country

(2, 2).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew stands next to an immortally still canine.)  A format change ended this show's shopping days in 1987, so these ceramic Dalmatians became collector's items

(3, 2).clue: A type of cricket that mainly lives underground is named for this tiny-eyed mammal

(4, 2).clue: 12-letter word for one who starts & assumes the risk of a business

(5, 2).clue: There's a reason this company's Rice Krispies is spelled with a "K"

(6, 2).clue: When Albee was honored by this center in 1996, Pres. Clinton said, "In your rebellion the Amer. theater was reborn"

(1, 3).clue: In 1886 this "Mad" Bavarian King was declared insane; he drowned a few days later

(2, 3).clue: Women went wild for red La Perla lingerie after Marcia Cross revelaed it under her fur coat on this series

(3, 3).clue: The male redback type of this creature, 1/3 the size of the female, dies happy if you know what I mean

(4, 3).clue: It's a hint or trace of something (sounds like of Campbell's)

(5, 3).clue: Procter & Gamble think this company they're buying, "G", won't "shave" any profits off its balance sheet

(6, 3).clue: (Edward Albee reads the clue.)  The new Broadway production of my play "Who's Afraid Of Virginia Woolf?" stars Bill Irwin & Kathleen Turner as this fun-loving couple

(1, 4).clue: The IV king of this name (following the Norman Conquest) brought the House of York to England's throne

(2, 4).clue: This whimsical talk-show host loves to give out donkey cigarette dispensers, & you can buy them on her website

(3, 4).clue: Newborn gazelles are a favorite prey of the black-backed species of this canine

(4, 4).clue: This word goes back to one building in Paris where "Jean Does" must have been taken

(5, 4).clue: If you have a "Q", just call this Baby Bell

(6, 4).clue: Brother Julian is ensnared by Miss Alice in this 1964 play that Albee called a "metaphysical melodrama"

(1, 5).clue: He's the last king of France whose reign straddled 2 centuries

(2, 5).clue: If you crave the cuisine made by this bubbly chef, check out her "30-Minute Meals" cookbooks

(3, 5).clue: One of Gerald Durell's nature books is called "Catch Me" this type of monkey, seen here

(4, 5).clue: French for "duck", it's a false or misleading story

(5, 5).clue: "C", this financial services company, brought Smith Barney under its umbrella

(6, 5).clue: (Edward Albee reads the clue.)  In my Tony-winning 2002 play, a family is torn asunder by the husband's pastoral passion for one of these farm animals

(0, 0).clue: It's the colorful 2-word term used to describe the motion of galaxies coming toward us, like Andromeda is
